page.title: 19Town or Country Life?
page.content: Twenty four parents and children of Glenisla School were asked three questions concerning their attitudes about whether or not they preferred country or town life giving reasons for their choice and the disadvantages, if any, against their choice. Twenty three people chose the country way of life in preference to living in a town or city.The twenty fourth person thought living in the country to be lonely for adults and children alike and that town life offered more amenities and a wider range of recreational activities. There were no stated disadvantages. The rest found country life to be quieter, more peaceful and things moved at a far more leisurely pace. The environment is much healthier, especially for the children.
